2022年是迎難而上的一年。

2022年伊始，全球經濟環境一片暗淡。新冠病毒變異株Omicron肆虐，令全球經濟增長繼續受壓，通脹壓力亦持續上升。其後俄羅斯與烏克蘭爆發衝突，進一步推高通脹壓力，導致各主要央行採取前置式貨幣緊縮政策，擴大環球金融市場的波動，並加劇經濟增長放緩的風險。本地方面，第五波疫情爆發，感染個案急速上升，亦進一步打擊經濟。同時，圍繞防疫措施與檢疫限制的負面報道，更令外界對香港產生誤解，威脅香港作為國際金融中心的聲譽。全年計，香港實質本地生產總值收縮了3.5%。

儘管面對重重挑戰，金管局繼續致力保障香港貨幣與金融穩定，並於主要策略範疇推進多項有利發展的措施，進一步鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位。經歷3年的旅遊限制後，我們成功向國際社會展示香港已全面復常，旅客亦能再次親身訪港體驗。金管局在去年11月舉辦「國際金融領袖投資峰會」，來自世界各地的金融領袖親身來港出席。外界如此熱烈的反應，成為印證香港全面復常最好不過的證明。

展望未來，外圍環境仍然充滿前所未有的不確定性。儘管如此，內地經濟重啟會為香港以至整個地區重新注入動力。金管局將繼續緊守崗位，履行維持香港貨幣與銀行體系穩定的職能，並積極尋求更多有利香港發展的機會，展現及提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。我們亦會繼續為提升全球氣候應變能力及可持續發展出力。今年除《二零二二年年報》外，我們會另外發表《二零二二年可持續發展報告》，以便更詳細地介紹金管局在提升香港作為綠色和可持續金融樞紐的地位所進行的各項工作，以及金管局作為負責任投資者及可持續機構所作出的努力。

# 貨幣及金融體系：堅穩如昔

聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）自1983年實施至今，歷經多個經濟周期，成功抵禦各種各樣的外來衝擊。2022年再次見證聯匯制度的抗震能力。在美國聯邦儲備局（聯儲局）大幅收緊貨幣政策下，弱方兌換保證於2022年5月至11月期間被觸發41次，金管局按照既定機制，以有序及具透明度的方式從市場買入合共2,421億港元。其間港元匯率及貨幣市場繼續運作暢順，反映聯匯制度穩健有效。

這份對聯匯制度的信心，來自於建立多年的穩固根基。正如國際貨幣基金組織在其《2022年對外部門報告》中重申，聯匯制度的公信力建基於多項因素，包括具高透明度的運作規則、充裕的外匯儲備、審慎的財政制度、穩健的金融監管，以及靈活的經濟結構。

我們深信除了穩健的機制外，致力與公眾及市場溝通以加深其對聯匯制度的了解、進行有效的市場監察，以及就不同情景作出應變計劃，均有助鞏固各界對聯匯制度的信心。我們就聯匯制度運作機制推出的社交媒體宣傳活動，有助在年內弱方兌換保證多次被觸發的情況下，有效維護市場對聯匯制度的信心。內部方面，金管局亦善用數據分析技術加強市場監察，讓我們能適時回應最新市場形勢。

年內，儘管面對宏觀層面的挑戰以及遞增的信用風險，香港銀行體系仍然維持穩健，資本及流動性均非常充裕。2022年底，本地銀行的綜合總資本充足比率為20.1%，遠高於國際最低要求的8%。2022年第4季，大型銀行的流動性覆蓋比率稍升至162.3%，亦遠高於法定最低要求的100%。鑑於信貸環境面對挑戰，銀行體系的資產質素略為轉差，特定分類貸款比率於2022年底升至1.38%，但有關水平仍屬穩健，並低於2000年以來的長期平均水平1.8%。

# 銀行體系：有效監管確保運作穩健

疫情持續3年，來自各方面的挑戰均有所加劇，例如地緣政治緊張局勢升溫及主要央行收緊貨幣政策。然而，全賴多年來妥善的風險管理及有效的監管，香港銀行體系得以維持穩健，繼續發揮支持經濟的重要作用。

過去一年面對的一項主要監管挑戰，是在第五波新冠疫情後經濟仍充滿不確定性之下，確保銀行繼續為客戶提供所需支援的同時，維持穩健的信用風險管理。「預先批核還息不還本」計劃進一步展期，並加入自願性部分本金還款選項，讓借款人可以選擇開始償還部分本金，協助客戶就最終回復正常還款作好準備。

因應主要經濟體大幅收緊貨幣政策令市場波動加劇，2022年金管局另一項主要監管工作是加強監察銀行的市場及流動性風險承擔。我們深入評估各經濟體同步收緊貨幣政策對銀行可能產生的影響，並就壓力測試引入新情景，以評估銀行應對長時間流動性壓力的韌性。

與此同時，我們繼續採取具前瞻性的措施，促進在多個範疇的有效風險管理。在運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力方面，我們提供指引協助銀行制定綜合及全面的運作架構，以達致穩健經營，並就銀行具體的運作範疇提供詳盡監管指引，例如因應雲端技術普及而就使用雲端運算提供指引。此外，因應數碼化加速發展，我們亦加強了應對「網絡釣魚」騙案和推進消費者及投資者保障的工作。

除了維持銀行體系穩健外，金管局亦致力推動普及金融及提高銀行服務的便利性。銀行對於金管局就提供基本銀行服務的呼籲反應正面，有銀行在新發展地區的大型公共屋邨增設分行及自助銀行服務設施。受到疫情相關的旅遊限制影響，許多香港市民無法使用其內地銀行戶口。有見及此，金管局與有關各方緊密合作，協助重新啓動約50萬個內地銀行戶口，受影響戶口持有人無需親身前往內地辦理。

另一個對銀行業持續發展具策略重要性的範疇是提升專業能力。為擴展業務，銀行業對專業人才的需求仍然龐大。金管局在其人才發展策略 — 「連接人才與未來」— 的基礎上，在過去一年推出多項措施，協助銀行業吸引、培育及挽留人才，集中提升及再培訓現有從業員的技能，以及培育年輕一代，以建立可持續的人才庫。

# 國際金融中心：香港重回國際舞台!

實施多時的疫情相關旅遊限制於2022年逐步撤銷，我們作出了多方面的努力讓香港重回國際舞台。11月舉行的「國際金融領袖投資峰會」吸引超過200位來自環球金融機構的國際及地區負責人親臨香港，並獲得全球各地的關注及熱切迴響。儘管峰會舉行日期不巧遇上50年來首個在11月份發出的8號颱風訊號，峰會仍然十分成功，向世界傳遞了香港已全面復常並正展現無比朝氣與活力的有力訊息。我們很高興看到峰會產生了正面的漣漪效應，不少環球金融機構及國際組織現正或計劃在香港舉辦各類活動。

除吸引各地訪客重臨香港外，我和金管局的同事體會到面對面交流聯繫的重要性，因此盡可能親身代表香港出席主要國際會議，積極參與全球政策討論，並藉外訪機會與環球金融機構的集團管理層會面，加深他們對香港穩健的金融體系以及在「一國兩制」下香港提供的各種機遇的了解。

為確保香港保持作為國際金融中心的競爭力，我們在金融科技、內地機遇，以及綠色和可持續金融等策略性重點領域不斷開拓市場新界限。我們亦進一步加強本港的金融平台，提供頂尖的服務，吸引更多企業落戶香港。有關金管局在綠色和可持續金融方面的工作詳情，請參閱《二零二二年可持續發展報告》。

# 金融科技

繼2021年6月公布「金融科技2025」策略，2022年我們在五大範疇均取得顯著進展。

我們在「全面推展銀行數碼化」方面的工作取得理想成果。根據金融科技應用評估的結果，香港銀行業在不同業務領域廣泛採用金融科技，而且所採用的科技類別亦持續增加。我們自2017年以來逐步推廣及支持數碼化的工作獲銀行積極回應，並持續取得成果，成續令人鼓舞。我們將繼續與業界緊密合作，根據評估的結果，進一步推動金融科技在特定銀行業務領域的應用及促進個別科技類別的發展。

年內我們在央行數碼貨幣方面的工作邁進重要的新里程。「多種央行數碼貨幣跨境網絡」(mBridge)項目進入試行階段，並成為全球其中一個率先為企業跨境交易進行真實結算的央行數碼貨幣項目。在零售層面，數字人民幣跨境使用的技術測試已進入第二階段，主要測試通過「轉數快」為數字人民幣錢包增值。數碼港元方面，我們將採取三軌道方式為將來可能發行數碼港元作好準備，並推出第二軌道先導計劃，邀請業界深入研究數碼港元可行的應用場景。

數據可全面釋放金融科技的潛力。我們於去年10月推出的「商業數據通」正是提升香港數據基建的重要一步。作為以數據擁有人授權為本的共享數據基建，「商業數據通」能方便金融機構提取企業的商業數據，使企業（尤其中小型企業）更容易獲得融資。截至2022年底，「商業數據通」已促成超過1,000宗中小企貸款，總額逾19億港元。

最後，我們在擁抱金融創新和它帶來的好處的同時，亦明白有必要監察及處理好相關發展可能帶來的風險。我們正密切注視虛擬資產領域的發展，並參與相關監管事宜的國際討論。經考慮公眾諮詢收集到的意見及相關國際標準後，我們將採納「相同風險，相同監管」1 的方式制定穩定幣的監管制度及界定其監管範圍。未來我們率先規管的對象將是那些標榜與一種或以上法定貨幣的價值掛鈎的穩定幣，因為這類穩定幣可能對貨幣及金融穩定帶來更高及更迫切的潛在風險。我們相信在訂立適當的規範下，業界將可更安全穩妥地開拓數碼金融的潛力。

科技正重塑我們的未來。金管局與銀行業界正積極準備迎向這個「新常態」。我們有信心我們正構建的金融科技生態圈將有助全面釋放金融科技的潛力，並提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。

# 內地機遇
en:
2022 was a year of rising to challenges.

At the beginning of 2022, the global economic environment was bleak. The COVID-19 Omicron variant was ravaging, continuing to pressure global economic growth, with inflationary pressures also rising. Subsequently, conflicts erupted between Russia and Ukraine, further pushing up inflation, prompting major central banks to adopt front-loaded monetary tightening policies, which increased volatility in global financial markets and heightened the risk of slowing economic growth. Domestically, the fifth wave of COVID-19 broke out, with cases rising rapidly, further dampening economic activity. Meanwhile, negative reports surrounding pandemic measures and quarantine restrictions led to misunderstandings about Hong Kong's situation, threatening its reputation as an international financial centre. For the whole year, Hong Kong’s real local GDP contracted by 3.5%.

Despite many challenges, the HKMA continued to devote efforts to safeguarding Hong Kong’s monetary and financial stability, launching several measures to promote developments conducive to further strengthening Hong Kong’s position as an international financial centre. After three years of travel restrictions, we successfully demonstrated to the international community that Hong Kong has fully resumed normal operations, and travellers can once again visit in person. In November, the HKMA hosted the “International Financial Leaders Investment Summit,” which was attended in person by financial leaders from around the world. The enthusiastic response from the global community served as the best proof that Hong Kong has returned to normal and is showing vigorous vitality.

Looking ahead, the external environment remains fraught with unprecedented uncertainties. Nevertheless, the resumption of the Mainland economy will inject renewed momentum into Hong Kong and the entire region. The HKMA will continue to remain steadfast in its core functions of maintaining Hong Kong’s monetary and banking system stability, actively seeking more opportunities for Hong Kong’s development, and demonstrating and enhancing Hong Kong’s competitiveness as an international financial centre. We will also continue efforts to improve global climate resilience and advance sustainable development. This year, in addition to the “2022 Annual Report,” we will issue a separate “2022 Sustainable Development Report” to provide a more detailed account of the HKMA’s efforts in strengthening Hong Kong’s status as a green and sustainable financial hub, as well as Hong Kong’s role as a responsible investor and a sustainable organisation.

# Monetary and Financial System: Remains Steadfast as Always

Since its implementation in 1983, the Linked Exchange Rate System has endured multiple economic cycles, successfully resisting various external shocks. The system demonstrated its resilience once again in 2022. Under the significant tightening of monetary policy by the US Federal Reserve, the weak-side Convertibility Guarantee was triggered 41 times from May to November 2022. The HKMA, in accordance with established mechanisms, bought a total of HKD 242.1 billion from the market in an orderly and transparent manner. Throughout this period, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate and the currency markets continued to operate smoothly, reflecting the robustness and effectiveness of the Linked Exchange Rate System.

Our confidence in the system’s credibility is founded on solid groundwork built over many years. As reaffirmed in the IMF’s “External Sector Report 2022,” the credibility of the Linked Exchange Rate System rests on several factors, including transparent operation rules, ample foreign exchange reserves, prudent fiscal policies, sound financial regulation, and flexible economic structures.

We believe that, beyond robust mechanisms, effective communication with the public and market participants to deepen understanding of the currency link, active market surveillance, and scenario planning to address different contingencies all help reinforce confidence. Our social media campaigns explaining the operation of the currency link have contributed to maintaining market confidence even amid multiple triggers of the weak-side guarantee within the year. Internally, the HKMA has also harnessed data analytics tools to strengthen market monitoring, enabling timely responses to the latest market developments.

Despite macroeconomic challenges and increasing credit risks, Hong Kong’s banking system remained resilient throughout the year, with ample capital and liquidity. By the end of 2022, the aggregate capital adequacy ratio of local banks stood at 20.1%, well above the minimum requirement of 8%. In Q4 of 2022, the liquidity coverage ratio of major banks slightly increased to 162.3%, also well above the statutory minimum of 100%. Given the challenging credit environment, the asset quality of banks showed some deterioration, with the Category 2 ratio rising to 1.38% at the end of 2022; however, this level remains prudent and is lower than the long-term average of 1.8% since 2000.  

# Banking Sector: Effective Regulation Ensures Stable Operations

Having endured three years of the pandemic, challenges have intensified from all sides, including geopolitical tensions and major central banks tightening monetary policies. Nonetheless, thanks to many years of sound risk management and effective regulation, Hong Kong’s banking sector has remained resilient and continues to play a vital role in supporting the economy.

One key regulatory challenge over the past year was ensuring banks continued to provide necessary support to customers amid persistent economic uncertainties following the fifth wave of COVID-19, while maintaining prudent credit risk management. The “pre-approved repayment with no principal repayment” scheme was extended further, with the addition of voluntary partial principal repayment options, enabling borrowers to begin repaying part of their principal to prepare for eventual full recovery to normal repayment.

In response to the market volatility caused by significant monetary tightening in major economies, another major regulatory focus in 2022 was to enhance supervision of banks’ market and liquidity risk exposures. We conducted in-depth assessments of how simultaneous monetary tightening in multiple economies might impact banks, and introduced new stress testing scenarios to evaluate their resilience to prolonged liquidity pressures.

Meanwhile, we continued to adopt forward-looking measures to promote effective risk management across various areas. In terms of operational resilience and cyber defence, we provided guidelines to assist banks in formulating comprehensive operational frameworks to ensure sound management, including detailed regulatory guidance on specific operational aspects, such as the use of cloud computing given the proliferation of cloud technology. Additionally, in response to accelerated digitalisation, we strengthened work to address “phishing” scams and to enhance consumer and investor protection.

Beyond maintaining the resilience of the banking system, the HKMA is also committed to promoting financial inclusion and increasing the convenience of banking services. The banking sector responded positively to the HKMA’s call for providing basic banking services, with some banks establishing branches and self-service banking facilities in new development districts and public housing estates. Due to pandemic-related travel restrictions, many Hong Kong residents were unable to access their Mainland bank accounts. In this regard, the HKMA, working closely with relevant parties, assisted in relaunching around 500,000 Mainland bank accounts affected, without requiring account holders to travel to the Mainland in person.

Another strategic area vital for the ongoing development of the banking industry is enhancing professionals’ skills. To support business expansion, banks still have a strong demand for professional talents. Based on the HKMA’s talent development strategy—“Connecting Talents to the Future”—we launched several initiatives over the past year to help banks attract, nurture, and retain talent, focusing on upskilling and retraining existing staff, as well as cultivating the younger generation to build a sustainable talent pool.

# International Financial Centre: Hong Kong Returns to the Global Stage!

The prolonged COVID-19 travel restrictions eased gradually in 2022. We made concerted efforts to restore Hong Kong’s position on the international stage. The “International Financial Leaders Investment Summit” held in November attracted over 200 senior officials from global financial institutions to Hong Kong in person, gaining worldwide attention and enthusiastic responses. Despite coinciding with Typhoon Signal No. 8 — the first time in 50 years — the summit was highly successful, delivering a powerful message to the world that Hong Kong has fully resumed normal operations and is exhibiting vibrant energy and vitality. We are pleased to see that the summit generated positive ripple effects, with many global financial institutions and international organisations currently or planning to host events in Hong Kong.

In addition to attracting visitors from around the world, the HKMA and I personally recognize the importance of face-to-face interactions. We actively participate in major international conferences, representing Hong Kong to engage in global policy discussions, and use overseas visits as opportunities to meet with senior management from global financial institutions to deepen their understanding of Hong Kong’s resilient financial system and the opportunities under the “one country, two systems” framework.

To ensure Hong Kong remains competitive as an international financial centre, we continue to explore new markets and opportunities in areas such as financial technology, Mainland opportunities, green and sustainable finance. We further strengthen our financial platform to offer top-tier services and attract more enterprises to establish their presence in Hong Kong. For details of the HKMA’s work in green and sustainable finance, please refer to the “2022 Sustainable Development Report.”

# 2022年摘要

# 經濟及金融環境

受第五波新冠病毒疫情、金融狀況收緊及充滿挑戰的外圍環境等多項不利因素的影響，香港經濟在2022年顯著收縮。勞工市場首先轉差，其後逐步改善，而通脹則維持溫和。受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預計2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。

香港銀行體系在2022年繼續保持穩健，資本及流動性狀況維持充裕，資產質素繼續處於健康水平。

# 貨幣穩定

隨着美國收緊貨幣政策，港元轉弱，弱方兌換保證於年內被多次觸發。然而，港元外匯及貨幣市場繼續保持有序及暢順運作，一再證明聯繫匯率制度穩健有效。

# 儲備管理

2022年的投資環境異常動盪，多種資產類別的價格同時下挫，外匯基金錄得整體投資回報率為負4.5%，與市場上大部分多元資產基金的表現相比，虧損幅度相對溫和。

金管局亦繼續致力推動負責任投資及資產多元化。與此同時，長期增長組合自2009年開展投資以來的內部回報率年率為12.6%。

# 銀行體系穩定

面對金融市場波動擴大，金管局加強對銀行的信用及市場風險管理的監管，並與銀行緊密合作，提升銀行的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力，以應對網絡威脅持續增加及銀行業數碼轉型步伐加快的情況。

金管局進一步推出有關「先買後付」產品及新增物業轉按支付安排的消費者保障措施。此外，金管局與其他監管機構合作制定虛擬資產監管架構，並就分銷投資產品發出指引及推出全新的信託業務監管制度。有關個人信貸資料的「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」亦於年內啟用。

金管局繼續與銀行合作提升香港的打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統，並加強對騙案的回應措施，又透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」系列進一步推動數據與科技的應用，以及加快金管局就反洗錢工作採用監管科技的步伐。

金管局在本地實施有關資本充足標準及披露標準等國際監管標準方面取得良好進展。金管局亦與銀行業共同為未來發展努力建立可持續的人才庫及提升從業員的技能。

為確保香港備有具公信力的處置機制，金管局制定新處置標準，又進行地區危機模擬演習，並在所有具本地系統重要性銀行建立一層新的吸收虧損能力資源，為處置機制的發展立下重要的里程碑。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

「國際金融領袖投資峰會」取得成功，鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，並製造正面的漣漪效應。

中國人民銀行與金管局之間的貨幣互換協議於年內優化，進一步鞏固香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。金管局亦與其他監管機構及持份者合作，籌備開通「互換通」，及推出配合人民幣計價股票在港交易的雙櫃台莊家機制。另又致力發展債務工具中央結算系統成為亞洲區主要的國際中央證券託管平台。

在加強香港金融平台的競爭力方面取得良好進展，涵蓋債券發行、資產及財富管理、企業財資中心，以及綠色和可持續金融等範疇。

金管局亦繼續推行「金融科技2025」策略，促進金融業界採用金融科技，並提升香港作為金融科技樞紐的地位。快速支付系統「轉數快」隨着功能提升，使用量穩步增長。

# 機構職能

金管局透過不同渠道與社會及市場保持有效聯繫，提升公眾對金管局政策及工作的了解。

對內，金管局悉心建立一支強調靈活應變及可持續發展的工作團隊，同時遵守嚴格的財政紀律及提升資訊科技能力，應對變化及確保有效執行各項政策及措施。

# Summary of 2022

# Economic and Financial Environment

Under the influence of multiple adverse factors such as the fifth wave of COVID-19 pandemic, tightening of financial conditions, and a challenging external environment, Hong Kong’s economy contracted significantly in 2022. The labor market first deteriorated, then gradually improved, while inflation remained moderate. Benefiting from the comprehensive reopening between Mainland China and Hong Kong, it is expected that in 2023, Hong Kong’s economic growth will recover from lows.

Hong Kong’s banking sector continued to remain resilient in 2022, with capital and liquidity underpinned, and asset quality remaining at healthy levels.

# Currency Stability

As the United States tightened monetary policy, the Hong Kong dollar weakened, with the weak-side exchange guarantee being triggered multiple times throughout the year. However, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange and currency markets continued to operate in an orderly and smooth manner, further demonstrating the robustness and effectiveness of the Linked Exchange Rate System.

# Reserve Management

The investment environment in 2022 was exceptionally volatile, with prices across various asset classes declining simultaneously. The Exchange Fund recorded an overall investment return of -4.5%, with the loss relatively moderate compared to the performance of most diversified asset funds in the market.

The HKMA also continued to promote responsible investment and diversification of assets. Meanwhile, the internal return rate of the long-term growth portfolio since inception in 2009 was 12.6% annually.

# Stability of the Banking System

In face of expanding financial market volatility, the HKMA strengthened supervision of banks’ credit and market risk management, and worked closely with banks to enhance operational resilience and cyber defense capabilities, in response to the increasing cyber threats and the accelerating pace of digital transformation within the banking industry.

The HKMA further launched consumer protection measures related to “Buy Now, Pay Later” products and new property mortgage payment arrangements. Additionally, the HKMA collaborated with other regulators to develop a virtual assets regulatory framework, issued guidance on distributing investment products, and launched a brand-new trust business regulation regime. The “Multiple Credit Data Service Providers” model of credit data platforms for personal credit data was also implemented within the year.

The HKMA continued to work with banks to strengthen Hong Kong’s anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing ecosystem and enhanced responses to fraud cases. Through the “Anti-Money Laundering Regulatory Technology Laboratory” series, the HKMA promoted further application of data and technology, and accelerated the adoption of regtech in AML work.

The HKMA made good progress in implementing international regulatory standards such as capital adequacy and disclosure standards locally. It also worked jointly with the banking industry to build a sustainable talent pool and enhance practitioners’ skills for future development.

To ensure that Hong Kong maintains a credible resolution mechanism, the HKMA established new resolution standards, conducted regional crisis simulation exercises, and built a new layer of loss-absorbing capacity resources at all systemically important banks in Hong Kong, marking an important milestone in the development of the resolution framework.

# Hong Kong’s International Financial Centre Status

The “Hong Kong Financial Leaders Investment Summit” was successful, consolidating Hong Kong’s position as an international financial centre and generating positive ripple effects.

During the year, the currency swap agreement between the People’s Bank of China and the HKMA was optimized, further strengthening Hong Kong’s role as a global offshore RMB hub. The HKMA also collaborated with other regulators and stakeholders to prepare for the launch of the “Swap Connect” scheme and introduced a dual-tranche market-maker mechanism to facilitate RMB-denominated stock trading in Hong Kong. Moreover, efforts continued to develop the Central Clearing and Settlement System for debt instruments into Asia’s major international securities depository platform.

Hong Kong’s financial platform competitiveness saw good progress, covering bond issuance, asset and wealth management, corporate treasury centers, as well as green and sustainable finance.

The HKMA further continued to implement the “Fintech 2025” strategy, promoting fintech adoption across the industry and enhancing Hong Kong’s position as a fintech hub. The Faster Payment System (FPS), with expanded functionalities, saw steady growth in usage.

# Institutional Functions

The HKMA maintained effective communication channels with society and the market to enhance public understanding of its policies and work.

Internally, the HKMA built a capable team emphasizing agility and sustainable development, adhering to strict fiscal discipline, and upgrading information technology capabilities to adapt to changes and ensure the effective implementation of policies and measures.

# 2022 Major Events Summary

The government issued HKD 500 million 20-year Hong Kong dollar government bonds for the first time through a tender under the "Institutional Bond Issuance Programme."

HKMC Insurance Limited, wholly owned by Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation Limited, announced amendments and expansion of the Residential Mortgage Insurance Plan for completed residential properties.

The HKMA and the International Finance Corporation of the World Bank Group jointly launched the "Green Commercial Banking Alliance," and organized (virtually) the "Green and Sustainable Capital Markets Transformation Roundtable."

# 2023年工作重點及前瞻

儘管香港經濟在2023 年初出現復甦跡象，但外圍環境仍然充滿挑戰及不確定性。近期美國和歐洲的銀行業受壓，個別美國本土銀行在2023 年3 月倒閉，對環球金融市場造成漣漪效應，而主要央行收緊貨幣政策，很有可能令2023 年全球經濟增長放緩甚或衰退。另一方面，地緣政治局勢緊張，以及去全球化的威脅持續，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。儘管如此，香港金融體系憑藉多年來所建立穩健的抗震能力及充裕的緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。

金管局非常重視保障貨幣及金融穩定。展望未來，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局會保持警惕，力求迅速辨識正浮現的風險，並靈活應對。與此同時，金管局會繼續把握機遇及創造政策空間，進一步提升香港作為主要國際金融中心的地位。面對充滿挑戰的投資環境，金管局在管理外匯基金時會繼續審慎投資，同時保持足夠靈活性，按需要採取防禦措施，並維持高流動性。

# 金融體系保持穩定健全

環球經濟前景仍受制於重大的不確定因素。金管局會密切注視最新發展，提高警覺，防範各種潛在風險，以維持金融體系穩定健全；這是關乎持續提供關鍵金融服務的先決條件，因此亦是維繫香港經濟正常運作的命脈。

# 對潛在風險保持警惕

在2023年，美國利率未來走勢的不確定性，以及在先進經濟體銀行體系出現的壓力，可能會對主要先進經濟體的增長前景帶來下行風險。此外，持續的地緣政治風險，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。然而，香港金融體系憑藉過去多年所建立的抗震能力及緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。金管局亦有能力、資源及決心維持香港貨幣及金融穩定。

金管局將繼續密切注視本地及外圍環境的風險與脆弱性，並會按需要採取適當措施維持香港的貨幣及金融體系穩定。金管局亦會研究對香港經濟有影響的事項，以及評估與這些事項相關的潛在風險。

# 保持銀行體系穩定

鑑於地緣政治緊張局勢升級，以及各主要央行大幅加息以遏抑通脹，預計2023年銀行業的經營環境仍然充滿挑戰。另一方面，科技發展迅速及數碼化對銀行業來說既有危又有機。面對瞬息萬變的金融環境，金管局致力透過持續的監管工作確保銀行具足夠能力抵禦衝擊。與此同時，金管局亦會參照國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 風險為本的監管重點

# 信用、流動性及市場風險

在2023年，金管局將繼續密切注視認可機構的資產質素，並聚焦於認可機構的貸款分類及撥備做法，以及對財務狀況較差的借款人的管理。金管局亦會加強其監察系統，並採取積極措施確保銀行體系的整體信用風險水平維持可控。

另一方面，金管局會繼續留意企業的營運環境，並與銀行業及商界保持緊密溝通，以就最終退出「預先批核還息不還本」計劃作好準備，並同時確保暫時面對困難的客戶仍然得到適切的信貸支援。

此外，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局於2023年亦會加強監管認可機構的流動性及市場風險管理。

# 業務操作及科技風險

隨着銀行在業務營運中更廣泛應用科技，金管局會致力提升銀行業的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力。繼5月發出《監管政策手冊》新單元「運作穩健性」後，金管局會與業界保持緊密聯繫，審視認可機構在制定運作穩健性框架方面的進度。同時，金管局將透過跟進認可機構在「網絡防衛評估框架2.0」評估下發現的問題以及檢視認可機構實施穩固三重數據備份的進展，提高銀行業的網絡防衛能力。

隨着數碼化的步伐加快，金管局的其他監管重點包括加強對銀行的第三方服務供應商風險管理的監管，以及提升銀行業的數據管治能力。

# 打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集

在2023年，金管局的工作重點包括更新監管資訊、加強打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統各持份者的合作以應對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（洗錢）風險，以及進一步推動反洗錢監管科技與合規科技的發展。金管局的《打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集指引》亦會作出修訂，並會就「政治人物」採取與風險相稱的措施發出具體指引，從而促進業界以有效及風險為本的方法落實法例的主要修訂。與此同時，金管局會擴大現有公私營夥伴合作的涵蓋範圍以加強訊息共享，以及支持推出銀行之間的訊息共享平台，藉以加快偵測可疑戶口及防範戶口被濫用，並加強對騙案受害人的保障和協助受害人追討損失。金管局亦會透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」及其他反洗錢合規科技項目，進一步集中推動採用合規科技（包括數據分析），並致力發展宏觀分析能力，以配合其數據為本的反洗錢監管工作。透過實施上述各項措施，金管局將能更迅速針對傀儡戶口網絡等系統性洗錢風險採取相應措施，以及靈活應對不斷轉變的威脅。

# 財富管理業務

金管局在2023年會加強有關認可機構在財富管理以及銷售證券、強制性公積金（強積金）與其他投資及保險產品方面的操守的現場審查及非現場監察。2023年的重點將會是「跨境理財通」計劃、數碼分銷及諮詢平台、虛擬資產、環境、社會及管治(ESG)投資產品及長期保險產品。金管局在有關過程中會參考市場最新發展及國際標準的修訂。

金管局亦會與其他監管機構及銀行界緊密聯繫，並按需要就銷售投資、保險及強積金產品的監管標準向認可機構提供指引，其中亦會包括有關提供虛擬資產相關投資服務的指引。就此而言，為促進虛擬資產行業可持續及負責任地發展，金管局會積極參與相關國際組織，並與政府及其他金融監管機構合作，制定全面的虛擬資產監管架構。

隨着「跨境理財通」順利推出，金管局會與業界及相關監管機構聯繫，以優化該計劃。此外，金管局亦會與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）及業界合作，精簡投資產品銷售程序（包括適用於資深投資者的銷售程序），以及開始根據相關《監管政策手冊》新單元及新營運守則監管認可機構的信託業務。

# 監察金融市場基建

金管局的目標是按照《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》（《支付條例》）、《金融市場基建的原則》（《基建原則》），以及支付及金融基建委員會發出的各項指引促進其所監察的金融市場基建的安全及效率，按需要參照最新的國際標準評估各項基建。金管局會參與支付及金融基建委員會與國際證監會組織對實施《基建原則》的監察及評估計劃，亦會參與國際標準制定組織的工作，並參照國際慣例或因應市場及科技發展加強本身的監察規定。同時，如有需要，金管局會與有關當局合作，進一步加強合作監察安排。

# 制定政策

金管局會因應國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 在香港實施巴塞爾標準

# 資本標準

金管局會透過實施巴塞爾銀行監管委員會（巴塞爾委員會）近年發布的標準，進一步優化資本框架，當中包括：
- 2017年12月《巴塞爾協定三：危機後改革的最終方案》、2019年1月（2019年2月修訂）《市場風險最低資本規定》，以及2020年7月《信用估值調整風險架構具針對性的修訂》所載的經修訂資本標準 — 上述經修訂資本標準統稱《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案，載明信用風險、市場風險、信用估值調整風險及業務操作風險的新監管處理方法，並引入出項下限規定，以及優化槓桿比率框架。經過2022年的多輪業界諮詢後，金管局計劃在2023年就《銀行業（資本）規則》（《資本規則》）的建議修訂進行法定諮詢，以實施上述各項規定及正值中性逆周期緩衝資本。有關修訂預計於同年內提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序，並不早於2024年1月1日生效，作為最低要求。
- 2022年12月《加密資產風險承擔的審慎處理方法》金管局計劃按照巴塞爾委員會的時間表，在2025年1月1日於本地實施有關標準，並打算於2023年就相關建議諮詢業界。

# 風險承擔限度

金管局於2023年3月就《銀行業（風險承擔限度）規則》的建議修訂諮詢業界。有關建議修訂主要是因應金管局實施上文提及的《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案下的經修訂資本標準而提出。諮詢文件亦包括就《資本規則》下有關官方實體集中風險的處理方法所作出的其他相應修訂。經修訂規則的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 流動性標準

金管局擬於2023年諮詢業界有關透過《2023年銀行業（流動性）（修訂）規則》（《2023年流動性修訂規則》）對《銀行業（流動性）規則》作出的建議修訂。相關修訂是因應同時期的《資本規則》建議修訂而作出，所以《2023年流動性修訂規則》的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 披露標準

《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案中與經修訂資本標準相關的新的及經修訂的披露規定，主要載於巴塞爾委員會分別於2018年12月及2021年11月發出的《第三支柱1 披露規定 — 更新框架》及《修訂市場風險披露規定》。巴塞爾委員會亦於2019年6月發出《修訂槓桿比率披露規定》，藉修訂槓桿比率的披露規定處理對潛在「粉飾櫥窗」（指銀行在報告日期前後減少某些交易的交易量，從而人為地提高報告及公開披露的槓桿比率）的關注。為在香港實施上述新的及經修訂的披露規定，金管局亦正擬備《銀行業（披露）規則》（《披露規則》）的相應修訂，以及經修訂後的標準披露模版及表格，並在過程中徵詢業界意見。預計《披露規則》的修訂將於2023年內連同《資本規則》的修訂一併提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序。

# 2023 Work Priorities and Outlook

Although Hong Kong’s economy showed signs of recovery at the beginning of 2023, the external environment remains challenging and uncertain. Recently, the banking industry in the US and Europe has been under pressure, with some US domestic banks collapsing in March 2023, causing ripple effects in the global financial markets, while major central banks have tightened monetary policies. This could likely lead to a slowdown or recession in the global economy in 2023. Meanwhile, geopolitical tensions and the ongoing threat of de-globalisation may continue to drag on global trade and cause occasional volatility in the worldwide financial markets. Nonetheless, Hong Kong’s financial system remains underpinned by years of robust resilience and ample buffers, enabling it to withstand adverse shocks.

The HKMA attaches great importance to safeguarding monetary and financial stability. Looking ahead, in the face of an uncertain macroeconomic environment, the HKMA will stay vigilant, swiftly identifying emerging risks, and responding flexibly. At the same time, the HKMA will continue to seize opportunities and create policy space to further enhance Hong Kong’s position as a major international financial centre. Amid a challenging investment environment, the HKMA will maintain prudence in managing the Exchange Fund, while ensuring sufficient flexibility and adopting defensive measures as needed, sustaining high liquidity.

# Maintaining a Stable and Sound Financial System

The global economic outlook remains subject to significant uncertainties. The HKMA will closely monitor the latest developments, raise alertness, and prevent potential risks to maintain the stability and soundness of the financial system; this is essential for continuously providing key financial services and is vital to the normal operation of Hong Kong’s economy.

# Vigilance Against Potential Risks

In 2023, the uncertainty over the future trend of US interest rates and pressures within financial institutions in advanced economies could pose downside risks to growth prospects in these economies. Additionally, ongoing geopolitical risks may continue to hinder global trade and result in market volatility. Nevertheless, Hong Kong’s financial system remains resilient, thanks to its longstanding buffers and resilience. The HKMA also has the capacity, resources, and resolve to maintain monetary and financial stability in Hong Kong.

The HKMA will continue to carefully observe local and external risks and vulnerabilities, taking appropriate measures where necessary to sustain the stability of Hong Kong’s monetary and financial systems. It will also study matters affecting Hong Kong’s economy and assess related potential risks.

# Ensuring Stability of the Banking System

Given escalating geopolitical tensions and major central banks raising interest rates significantly to curb inflation, it is anticipated that the banking environment in 2023 will remain challenging. On the other hand, rapid technological development and digitalisation present both risks and opportunities for banks. In response to the rapidly changing financial environment, the HKMA is committed to strengthening bank resilience through ongoing supervision, aligned with international standards and best practices, continuously refining and optimising the banking regulatory framework and policies.

# Risk-Based Regulatory Focus

# Credit, Liquidity, and Market Risks

In 2023, the HKMA will continue to closely monitor asset quality of authorised institutions, focusing on loan classification and provisioning methodologies, as well as managing borrowers with weaker financial conditions. It will also strengthen its supervisory system and actively ensure that the overall credit risk level of the banking sector remains manageable.

Moreover, the HKMA will keep an eye on corporate operational environments, maintain close communication with the banking industry and business sector, and prepare for the eventual exit of the “pre-approved principal repayment not interest-only” scheme, while also ensuring that customers facing temporary difficulties continue to receive appropriate credit support.

Additionally, facing an uncertain macroeconomic environment, the HKMA will reinforce the supervision of liquidity and market risk management of authorised institutions in 2023.

# Business Operations and Technology Risks

As banks increasingly adopt technology in their operations, the HKMA aims to enhance banking operational robustness and cyber resilience. Following the issuance of the new section “Operational Resilience” in the Supervisory Policy Manual in May, the HKMA will maintain close contact with the industry to review progress in establishing operational resilience frameworks. Simultaneously, it will follow up on issues identified through the “Cyber Resilience Evaluation Framework 2.0” assessment and monitor the implementation of robust triple data backup by authorised institutions to bolster cyber resilience.

With digitalisation accelerating, other regulatory priorities include strengthening oversight of third-party service provider risks and enhancing banks’ data governance capabilities.

# Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing

In 2023, the HKMA’s focus includes updating supervisory information, strengthening cooperation among stakeholders in the anti-money laundering (AML) ecosystem, and promoting the development of AML and RegTech for compliance. The HKMA’s “Guidelines on Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing” will be revised; specific guidance will be issued on measures proportionate to the risk posed by “politically exposed persons,” facilitating a risk-based approach in implementing legal amendments. The HKMA will also expand existing public-private partnerships to enhance information sharing, support the rollout of inter-bank information sharing platforms to speed up suspicious account detection and prevent account abuse, and bolster protection and assistance for victims of scams.

Furthermore, the HKMA will advance the adoption of compliance technology, including data analytics, through initiatives such as the “AML Compliance Tech Lab,” and develop macro analytical capabilities to support data-driven AML supervision. These measures will enable more agile responses to systemic risks such as shell account networks, and adapt to evolving threats efficiently.

# Wealth Management Business

In 2023, the HKMA will strengthen on-site examinations and off-site monitoring of authorised institutions’ conduct in wealth management, securities sales, Mandatory Provident Fund (MPF), and other investment and insurance products. The key focuses will include the “Cross-boundary Wealth Management Connect” scheme, digital distribution and advisory platforms, virtual assets, Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) investment products, and long-term insurance products. The HKMA will consider latest market developments and revisions of international standards in these processes.

It will also cooperate with other regulators and the banking sector to provide guidance on supervisory standards for the sale of investment, insurance, and MPF products, including regulations related to virtual asset investment services. To foster sustainable and responsible development of the virtual asset industry, the HKMA will actively participate in relevant international organisations and work with the government and other financial regulators to develop a comprehensive virtual asset regulatory framework.

Following the successful launch of the “Cross-boundary Wealth Management Connect,” the HKMA will coordinate with industry and relevant authorities to optimise the scheme. It will also work with the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) and industry to streamline sales procedures for investment products (including those for senior investors), and supervise trust business of authorised institutions according to new supervisory policy manual chapters and revised operational codes.

# Monitoring Financial Market Infrastructure

The HKMA’s aim is to promote the safety and efficiency of financial market infrastructure under its supervision in accordance with the “Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance” (the “Ordinance”), the “Principles for Financial Market Infrastructure” (“PBMI”), and relevant guidelines issued by the Payments and Market Infrastructure Committee. It will participate in monitoring and evaluation programs with the International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) on the implementation of the “Principles,” and contribute to international standards development, adjusting regulations based on international best practices and market and technological developments. When necessary, it will cooperate with relevant authorities to strengthen collaborative supervision arrangements.

# Policy Formulation

The HKMA will continue to enhance and optimise its banking supervisory framework and policies in response to international standards and best practices.

# Implementing Basel Standards in Hong Kong

# Capital Standards

The HKMA will implement standards issued by the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS) to further refine the capital framework, including:
- The December 2017 “Basel III: Finalising post-crisis reforms,” January 2019 (revised in February 2019) “Minimum Capital Requirements for Market Risk,” and July 2020 “Revisions to the Risk Framework for Credit Valuation Adjustment (CVA) Risk,” collectively referred to as the “Final Basel III Reforms.” These standards specify new supervisory approaches for credit, market, CVA, and operational risks, introduce output floor provisions, and optimise the leverage ratio framework. After industry consultations in 2022, the HKMA plans to undertake statutory consultation in 2023 on proposed amendments to the “Banking (Capital) Rules” (“Capital Rules”) to implement these reforms and the countercyclical capital buffer. The amendments are expected to be submitted to the Legislative Council within the same year with the minimum requirement coming into effect no earlier than January 1, 2024.
- The December 2022 “Supervisory Treatment of Crypto-Asset Risks,” with plans for the HKMA to implement these standards locally by January 1, 2025, following the BCBS timetable, and to solicit industry feedback on related proposals in 2023.

# Risk Appetite Limits

In March 2023, the HKMA consulted industry on proposed amendments to the “Banking (Risk Appetite Limits) Rules,” mainly to align with the revised capital standards under the Final Basel III Reforms. The proposals also include related adjustments regarding the handling of systemic risk arising from official entities under the “Capital Rules.” The implementation date for these amendments will be no earlier than January 1, 2024, coinciding with the phased implementation of credit risk components of the revised Capital Rules.

# Liquidity Standards

The HKMA intends to consult the industry in 2023 on proposed amendments to the “Banking (Liquidity) Rules,” through the “2023 Banking (Liquidity) (Amendment) Rules.” These proposals are in response to the proposed revisions to the “Capital Rules,” with the same implementation timeline, i.e., no earlier than January 1, 2024.

# Disclosure Standards

The new and revised disclosure requirements related to the revised capital standards are mainly outlined in the Basel Committee’s December 2018 and November 2021 publications of the “Third Pillar 1 Disclosure Dispositions — Updated Framework” and the “Revised Market Risk Disclosure Requirements.” Additionally, the BCBS issued the June 2019 “Revisions to the Leverage Ratio Disclosure Requirements,” addressing concerns over potential “window dressing” (where banks may temporarily reduce certain trading volumes near reporting dates to artificially inflate the reported and disclosed leverage ratio). To implement these new and revised disclosure requirements in Hong Kong, the HKMA is preparing amendments to the “Banking (Disclosures) Rules” (“Disclosure Rules”), along with standard disclosure templates and forms, with industry consultation during the process. The amendments to the Disclosure Rules are expected to be submitted to the Legislative Council within 2023 along with those for the Capital Rules for prior approval.

# 機構管治

金管局作為香港的中央銀行機構，深明良好的管治對維持及維護公眾對金管局履行其法定職責的信任及信心的重要性，因此一直致力秉持高水平的機構管治。

為實踐良好機構管治的承諾，金管局：
- 建立了一套清晰且具備高問責性的機構管治架構；
- 實施完善穩健的監控措施以管理風險，並確保所有職級員工的行為及其日常運作均符合指定標準；及
- 奉行具透明度及保持開放的政策，與各持份者保持緊密聯繫。

# 金管局與香港特別行政區政府

金管局是香港特別行政區政府（特區政府）架構的一部分，但可以按與公務員不同的聘用條款聘請員工，以吸引具適當經驗與專門知識的人才。金管局總裁及其員工均為公職人員。金管局的日常運作，在金融管理專員所獲賦予或轉授的法定權力範圍內高度自主。

財政司司長負責釐定香港的貨幣政策目標及貨幣體制：財政司司長於2003年6月25日致金融管理專員的函件中，訂明應透過貨幣發行局制度維持貨幣穩定，將港元匯率保持在約7.80港元兌1美元的水平。金融管理專員須自行負責達成貨幣政策目標，包括決定有關的策略、工具及執行方式，並負責維持香港貨幣制度的穩定與健全。

財政司司長在財經事務及庫務局局長的協助下，負責維持香港金融體系穩定與健全，以及保持香港的國際金融中心地位的政策。為推行這些政策，金融管理專員的職責包括：
- 促進銀行體系的整體穩定與有效運作；
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，發展債務市場；
- 處理與法定紙幣及硬幣的發行及流通有關的事宜；
- 透過發展支付、結算及交收系統，以及在適當情況下負責操作有關系統，促進金融基建的安全與效率；及
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，促進對香港貨幣及金融體系的信心，並推行適當的發展市場措施，以協助加強香港金融服務的國際競爭力。

外匯基金由財政司司長掌有控制權。金融管理專員須根據財政司司長轉授的權力，就外匯基金的運用及投資管理向財政司司長負責。

# 問責性與透明度

就日常運作及推行政府政策目標所採用的方法，金管局一直保持高度自主，並同時輔以高問責性及透明度。

金管局致力促進貨幣與銀行體系穩定，有效管理官方儲備，發展與監察穩健及多元化的金融基建，從而鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，推動香港經濟發展。

金管局要有效履行職責，便必須取得社會人士的信任。因此，金管局以嚴謹的態度，履行向公眾解釋其政策及工作的責任，並盡力處理備受社會關注而涉及金管局職責範圍的事項。尤其，金管局透過傳統及社交媒體適時澄清有關金管局政策的失實資訊及謠言。

金融管理專員由財政司司長委任，因此金管局透過財政司司長向公眾負責；而由於金管局的職權由立法會通過的法律制訂，因此金管局亦透過立法會向公眾負責。金管局亦明白本身肩負更廣泛的責任，就是促進公眾對金管局角色及目標的認識，並密切留意社會人士所關注的事項。金管局在執行日常工作及與社會保持廣泛聯繫時，堅守盡力提高透明度及保持開放的政策。這項政策有兩大目標：
- 在顧及市場敏感性、商業秘密及機密資料披露的法定限制下，盡量使金融界及公眾充分了解金管局的工作；及
- 確保金管局掌握社會脈搏，並對公眾意見作出適當回應。

金管局在透明度方面致力達致國際最高標準，與傳媒保持廣泛聯繫之餘，亦出版各種中英文期刊及專題刊物。金管局的雙語網站(www.hkma.gov.hk)除有專門環節列載經濟研究、統計資料、監管資源、消費者資訊及其他課題外，還載有大量金管局出版的刊物、新聞稿、演辭及簡報會資料文件。此外，金管局又利用社交媒體平台，以能在數碼時代中更有效與公眾溝通。金管局辦事處設有資訊中心，分為圖書館及展覽館兩部分，每星期開放6日予公眾參觀及使用。有關金管局與公眾溝通及聯繫的工作，詳見「機構職能」一章（第157至162頁）。

金管局公布外匯基金及貨幣發行局帳目資料的次數，一直逐步增加，內容亦越趨詳細。金管局於1999年開始參與國際貨幣基金組織的中央銀行「數據公布特殊標準」計劃。金管局亦公布外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄，以及貨幣發行局制度運作報告。自1996年起，金管局網站載有銀行業監管政策及指引。

金管局與立法會的關係對提高問責性及透明度非常重要。金管局總裁承諾每年3次向立法會財經事務委員會簡報金管局各項工作及政策，並回答有關查詢。此外，金管局代表不時出席立法會事務委員會及小組委員會會議，闡釋及商討特別事項，以及協助議員審閱條例草案。

# 監控措施

金管局採用穩健有效的內部及外部監控機制，確保秉持高水平的員工操守、審慎的風險管理，以及適當的制衡。內部及外部審計職能就監控機制是否足夠及具成效提供獨立評估。

# 行為守則

《行為守則》就員工的道德與法律責任提供指引，確保所有職級員工的行為均符合指定標準。

# 內部監控

# 運作監控

作為風險管理的第一度防線，所有部門及分處均有責任評估其工作流程的風險，並制定適當的監控措施，確保金管局日常運作穩妥。

# 機構風險管理

風險管理亦在機構層面進行。由金管局總裁擔任主席的風險委員會，是機構風險管理架構的基石之一。

風險委員會審視和商討各部門所識別的潛在及新生風險，以及相關監控措施和緩解策略是否充足，並由該會定出適當的跟進行動。

# 內部審計

金管局內部審核處獨立評估不同部門的管治程序、風險管理及監控措施是否足夠及具成效，並提出改善建議。

# 外部審計

根據《外匯基金條例》第7條，外匯基金的財務報表由香港特區政府審計署審核。審計署並無就此項服務收取費用。經審核的外匯基金財務報表刊載於金管局《年報》。

# Institutional Governance

As Hong Kong’s Central Bank, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) recognizes the importance of good governance in maintaining and reinforcing public trust and confidence in the HKMA's fulfillment of its statutory responsibilities. Therefore, it has always been committed to upholding high standards of corporate governance.

To implement its commitment to good corporate governance, the HKMA:
- Established a clear and highly accountable governance framework;
- Implemented robust monitoring measures to manage risks and ensure that all staff behave in accordance with prescribed standards in their daily operations; and
- Maintains policies of transparency and openness, maintaining close contact with stakeholders.

# HKMA and the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government

The HKMA is part of the Hong Kong SAR Government’s structure but can employ staff under terms different from civil service employment to attract talents with appropriate experience and expertise. The Chief Executive of the HKMA and its staff are public officers. The daily operations of the HKMA are highly autonomous within the scope of statutory powers conferred or delegated by the Financial Secretary.

The Financial Secretary is responsible for setting Hong Kong’s monetary policy objectives and monetary system: In a letter to the Financial Secretary dated June 25, 2003, the Monetary Authority specified that the currency stability should be maintained through the Currency Board System, keeping the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate around 7.80 HKD to 1 USD. The Financial Secretary must independently achieve monetary policy objectives, including deciding on relevant strategies, tools, and implementation methods, and is responsible for maintaining the stability and soundness of Hong Kong’s currency system.

With assistance from the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, the Financial Secretary is responsible for maintaining the stability and soundness of Hong Kong’s financial system and for policies to uphold Hong Kong’s status as an international financial centre. To implement these policies, the duties of the Financial Management Specialist include:
- Promoting overall stability and effective operation of the banking system;
- Collaborating with relevant institutions and organizations to develop the debt market;
- Handling issuance and circulation of legal tender notes and coins;
- Facilitating the safety and efficiency of financial infrastructure through the development of payment, clearing, and settlement systems, and managing these systems when appropriate; and
- Working with relevant institutions and organizations to foster confidence in Hong Kong’s monetary and financial systems, implementing appropriate market development measures to enhance Hong Kong’s international competitiveness in financial services.

The Foreign Exchange Fund is controlled by the Financial Secretary. The Financial Management Specialist, based on powers delegated by the Financial Secretary, is responsible to the Financial Secretary for the management and investment of the Foreign Exchange Fund.

# Accountability and Transparency

Regarding daily operations and the methods used to implement government policy objectives, the HKMA maintains a high level of autonomy while ensuring high accountability and transparency.

The HKMA aims to promote stability in the monetary and banking systems, effectively manage official reserves, develop and monitor robust and diversified financial infrastructure, thereby consolidating Hong Kong’s position as an international financial centre and promoting economic development.

To effectively fulfill its responsibilities, the HKMA must earn public trust. It therefore rigorously explains its policies and work to the public, and strives to address matters of public concern within its scope of responsibilities. Particularly, the HKMA timely clarifies misinformation and rumors concerning its policies through traditional and social media.

The Financial Management Specialist is appointed by the Financial Secretary, so the HKMA is accountable to the public through the Financial Secretary; because its authority is established by legislation passed by the Legislative Council, it is also accountable through the Legislative Council. The HKMA also seeks to enhance understanding of the public regarding its role and objectives, and closely monitors matters of public concern. In executing its daily work and maintaining broad social engagement, the HKMA adopts a policy of striving for transparency and openness. This policy aims to:
- Maximize transparency of the HKMA’s work within statutory limits regarding market sensitivity, commercial secrets, and confidential information; and
- Keep in touch with social sentiment and appropriately respond to public opinions.

In terms of transparency, the HKMA endeavors to meet international standards. It maintains extensive contacts with the media, publishes various bilingual journals and special publications, and provides disclosures on its bilingual website (www.hkma.gov.hk), which includes dedicated sections on economic research, statistics, supervisory resources, consumer information, and other topics. The website also hosts numerous publications, press releases, speeches, and conference materials issued by the HKMA. Additionally, the HKMA actively uses social media platforms to communicate more effectively with the public in the digital age. Its Information Centre, comprising a library and an exhibition hall, is open six days a week to visitors and the public. Details on the HKMA’s communication and engagement with the public are found in the chapter “Institutional Functions” (pages 157-162).

The frequency of publication of the HKMA’s accounts of the Exchange Fund and the Currency Issue Department has gradually increased, with details becoming more comprehensive over time. The HKMA has participated since 1999 in the International Monetary Fund’s Central Bank Data Dissemination Standard (SDDS). It also publishes meeting records of the Currency Issue Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee and reports on the operation of the Currency Issue System. Since 1996, the HKMA’s website has included policies and guidelines on banking supervision.

The relationship between the HKMA and the Legislative Council is crucial for enhancing accountability and transparency. The HKMA’s Chief Executive commits to briefing the Legislative Council’s Finance Committee three times annually on its work and policies, and to responding to inquiries. Moreover, representatives of the HKMA regularly attend meetings of the Legislative Council’s panels and subcommittees to explain and discuss specific issues, assisting members in reviewing legislative proposals.

# Monitoring Measures

The HKMA employs effective internal and external monitoring mechanisms to ensure adherence to high standards of staff integrity, prudent risk management, and proper checks and balances. Internal and external audit functions provide independent assessments of the sufficiency and effectiveness of these monitoring mechanisms.

# Code of Conduct

The Code of Conduct provides guidelines on employees’ ethical and legal responsibilities, ensuring that staff at all levels conform to prescribed standards.

# Internal Controls

# Operational Monitoring

As the first line of defense in risk management, all departments and divisions are responsible for assessing risks in their workflows and establishing appropriate monitoring measures to ensure smooth daily operations of the HKMA.

# Corporate Risk Management

Risk management is also conducted at the corporate level. The Risk Committee, chaired by the HKMA’s Chief Executive, is a cornerstone of the risk management framework.

The Risk Committee reviews and discusses potential and emerging risks identified by various departments, along with whether the monitoring measures and mitigation strategies are adequate, and sets appropriate follow-up actions.

# Internal Audit

The HKMA’s Internal Audit Division independently assesses whether governance procedures, risk management, and monitoring measures across departments are sufficient and effective, and offers recommendations for improvement.

# External Audit

In accordance with Section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance, the financial statements of the Exchange Fund are audited by the Hong Kong SAR Government’s Audit Commission. The HKMA incurs no charges for this service. The audited financial statements of the Exchange Fund are published in the HKMA Annual Report.

# 經濟及金融環境

# 經濟回顧

# 實體經濟活動

受本地及外圍環境各項不利因素拖累，香港經濟在2022年收縮3.5%（表1及圖1）。本地方面，由於香港爆發第五波新冠病毒疫情，私人消費在第1季急跌，其後受惠於社交距離措施逐步放寬及政府消費券計劃的刺激，私人消費再度錄得按季增長。在營商氣氛疲弱及金融狀況收緊下，整體投資支出較2021年顯著下跌。對外方面，隨着外部需求轉弱，加上內地與香港之間的跨境陸路貨運受阻，香港貨物出口下挫。服務輸出依然大致疲弱，部分反映訪港旅遊活動低迷，但其後隨着政府於9月下旬撤銷抵港強制檢疫要求，情況於第4季稍為改善。

# 通脹

本地通脹壓力於2022年稍升，但仍屬溫和。具體而言，按年基本通脹率逐步上升至12月2%的溫和水平，其中外圍能源及食品價格高企的影響部分被溫和的本地成本壓力所抵銷，尤其是偏軟的房屋租金（圖2）。此外，在經濟活動疲弱下，名義工資增長及商業樓宇租金持續偏軟，亦有助遏抑通脹。2022年全年合計，基本及整體通脹率分別為1.7%及1.9%。

# 勞工市場

疫情下勞工市場狀況在2022年初急速惡化，但隨後持續改善。失業率在4月升至5.4%的高位後，於12月顯著回落至3.5%（圖3），當中大多數行業的失業率均有所下降。總就業人數（圖3）及私營機構職位空缺回升，反映整體勞工需求逐步回復，惟總就業人數仍低於疫情前水平。名義工資和勞工收入的按年升幅亦略為加快。另一方面，與去年同期比較，勞動人口於12月略為減少1.5%，部分原因是勞動人口參與率輕微下跌。

# 股市

本港股市在2022年出現大幅波動。承接2021年的下行趨勢，恒生指數加速下跌，在2022年10月31日收報14,687點，是自2009年以來的最低水平（圖4）。股市顯著調整，最初是由市場對本地新冠病毒疫情、美國加息及俄烏局勢的憂慮加劇所觸發，其後由於環球金融狀況收緊及內地新冠病毒疫情導致環球經濟前景轉差，令股市調整幅度進一步擴大。股市在年內最後兩個月重拾一些上升動力，部分受到內地優化防疫抗疫措施所支持。恒生指數於年底收報19,781點，較2021年底顯著下跌15.5%，連續第三年下挫。

# 物業市場

在金融狀況收緊及經濟活動疲弱下，住宅物業市場亦有所受壓。樓價於2022年回落15%（圖4），成交量也大幅縮減39%至45,050宗，創下有紀錄以來的新低。儘管樓價下跌，置業負擔能力仍然偏緊。實際按揭利率於年內由約1.6厘上升至3.375至3.625厘，增加供樓人士的按揭供款負擔。非住宅物業市場亦進一步回軟。在空置率高企下，其價格有所回落，租金亦維持偏軟。

# 經濟前景

# 經濟環境

受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預期2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。儘管先進經濟體增長預期放緩將繼續拖累香港貨物出口，但內地經濟復甦及跨境陸路貨運限制撤銷，應能為本港經濟提供支持。內地與香港全面通關亦有望令香港入境旅遊及其他服務輸出顯著受惠，並提振本地營商氣氛及資本開支。私人消費亦將會在勞工市場轉強下進一步改善。政府預測2023年全年實質本地生產總值會顯著增長，介乎3.5至5.5%。然而，香港經濟增長前景仍受眾多風險及不明朗因素所影響，並很大程度上取決於美國聯邦儲備局政策利率走勢、全球增長前景、地緣政治局勢持續緊張以及本地入境旅遊的復甦步伐。

# 通脹及勞工市場

展望未來，預期本地通脹將輕微上升，但在各種因素互相抵銷下應保持溫和。儘管外圍價格應會維持高企，但由於部分主要經濟體的經濟活動轉弱及商品價格上行壓力緩和，外圍價格的上升動力或會進一步減弱。同樣地，隨着本地經濟復甦及勞工市場改善，本地成本壓力或會輕微上升，但房屋租金偏軟應繼續在一定程度上抵銷其影響。政府預測2023年全年合計的整體及基本通脹率分別為2.9%及2.5%。另一方面，勞工市場狀況有望隨着本地經濟活動復常而進一步改善。

# 銀行體系表現

香港銀行體系在2022年面對充滿挑戰的宏觀經濟環境，包括年初爆發第五波新冠病毒疫情、地緣政治局勢升溫，以及全球各大央行大幅度加息應對通脹上升等。面對各項挑戰，香港銀行應付裕如，資本及流動性狀況繼續保持充裕。年內銀行體系面對的信貸風險增加，但整體資產質素維持於健康水平。與此同時，利率上升促使銀行淨利息收入增加，但其正面影響因呆壞帳準備金增加及費用與佣金收入減少而被局部抵銷。整體而言，零售銀行盈利較2021年改善。

# 資產質素

銀行體系的特定分類貸款比率由2021年底的0.89%上升至2022年底的1.38%，逾期及經重組貸款比率於同期由0.56%升至0.85%（圖5）。中國內地相關貸款的特定分類貸款比率於2022年底為2.21%，亦較2021年底的0.89%上升。特定分類貸款比率上升，主要是由於部分內地房地產發展商的貸款評級被下調。儘管如此，銀行撥備充足，截至2022年底，銀行信貸撥備覆蓋率（即信貸撥備和特定分類貸款比率）約維持於80%。若將抵押品變現價值從呆壞帳餘額中扣除，銀行信貸撥備覆蓋率約140%。另一方面，2022年底住宅按揭貸款及信用卡貸款的拖欠比率仍然處於低位，分別為0.06%及0.23%（圖6）。

# 盈利走勢

銀行體系在2022年繼續錄得盈利。年內零售銀行的整體除稅前經營溢利上升19.0%（圖7）。盈利改善是受惠於淨利息收入（+34%）及外匯與衍生工具收入增加（+72%），但部分升幅被呆壞帳準備金增加（+151%）及費用與佣金收入減少（–19%）所抵銷。在加息環境下，淨息差由上一年的0.98%擴闊至2022年的1.31%（圖8）。年內市場波動增加，亦令銀行來自外匯及衍生工具業務的收入增加。呆壞帳準備金增加是由於須為新的特定分類貸款預留特殊準備金，而在金融市場表現疲弱下，費用及佣金收入減少。零售銀行成本與收入比率由2021年的54.7%，降至2022年的48.0%（圖9）。

# 資產負債表走勢

2022年銀行體系資產負債表擴大2.5%。資產上升是由於外匯及衍生工具持倉按市價計值增加。面對外圍不明朗因素及利率趨升，年內貸款需求減弱。相比2021年錄得3.8%的增幅，2022年貸款總額減少3.0%。其中在香港境外使用的貸款減少10.2%，貿易融資減少13.5%，在香港使用的貸款則稍增0.9%。中國內地相關貸款繼2021年增長3.7%後，於2022年減少4.4%。

在資產負債表的負債方面，銀行體系存款繼續錄得溫和增長。存款總額於2022年增加1.7%，相比2021年的增幅為4.6%。由於貸款總額減少而存款總額增加，整體貸存比率由2021年底的71.8%稍降至2022年底的68.5%（圖10）。

# 資本充足水平

銀行在2022年的資本狀況維持充裕。2022年底本地註冊認可機構的綜合總資本比率為20.1%，相比上一年為20.2%；一級資本比率為18.1%（圖11）。兩者均遠高於相關國際最低要求。《巴塞爾協定三》槓桿比率於2022年底為7.9%（圖12）。

# 流動性狀況

銀行體系的流動性狀況繼續維持穩健，成為在宏觀經濟環境不明朗因素加劇下的重要支柱。第1類機構的季度平均流動性覆蓋比率在2022年第4季為162.3%，第2類機構的季度平均流動性維持比率為63.2%（圖13）。銀行體系的主要資金來源仍然是客戶存款。於2022年底，第1類機構的穩定資金淨額比率及第2A類機構的核心資金比率分別為137.7%及155.7%（圖14）。以上所有4個比率均遠高於法定最低要求。

# Economic and Financial Environment

Faced with the fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, tightening of financial conditions, and challenging external environment, Hong Kong's economy contracted significantly in 2022. The labour market remained deteriorated for some time before gradually improving, while inflation remained moderate. Asset markets were also under pressure. Benefiting from comprehensive border reopening between Mainland China and Hong Kong, the economy is expected to recover from lows in 2023.

# Economic Review

# Real Economic Activities

Dragged down by adverse factors both domestically and externally, Hong Kong's economy shrank by 3.5% in 2022 (Tables 1 and Chart 1). Domestically, the outbreak of the fifth wave of COVID-19 led to a sharp decline in private consumption in the first quarter. Subsequently, supported by the gradual relaxation of social distancing measures and the government’s consumption voucher scheme, private consumption rebounded on a quarter-on-quarter basis. Due to weak business sentiment and tightening of financial conditions, overall investment expenditure fell notably compared to 2021. Externally, as external demand weakened and cross-border land freight between Mainland China and Hong Kong was hindered, Hong Kong's merchandise exports declined. Services exports remained largely subdued, partly reflecting depressed inbound tourism, but improved slightly in the fourth quarter after the government lifted quarantine requirements for arrivals in late September.

Source: Census and Statistics Department

Table 1 Real GDP growth by expenditure (compared to previous period)
Note: Seasonally adjusted total fixed capital formation is not shown with quarterly changes.
Source: Census and Statistics Department

# Inflation

Domestic inflationary pressures slightly increased in 2022 but remained moderate. Specifically, the annual core inflation rate gradually rose to a mild 2% by December. The impact of high external energy and food prices was partly offset by mild domestic cost pressures, especially soft housing rents (Chart 2). Moreover, weak economic activity led to slower growth in nominal wages and commercial property rents, helping contain inflation. For the whole year of 2022, the core and overall inflation rates were 1.7% and 1.9%, respectively.

# Labour Market

The labour market deteriorated sharply at the start of 2022 amid the pandemic but then continued to improve. The unemployment rate rose to a high of 5.4% in April and fell significantly to 3.5% in December (Chart 3), with unemployment rates declining across most industries. Total employment (Chart 3) and vacancies in the private sector rebounded, reflecting a gradual recovery in overall labour demand, although total employment remained below pre-pandemic levels. Nominal wages and labour income from a year earlier also grew at a slightly faster pace. Conversely, compared with the same period last year, the labour force decreased marginally by 1.5% in December, partly due to a slight decline in labour force participation rate.

Chart 2 Core consumer price inflation
Source: Census and Statistics Department, and staff estimates of HKMA

Chart 3 Labour market conditions
Source: Census and Statistics Department

# Stock Market

Hong Kong’s stock market experienced significant volatility in 2022. Continuing the downward trend of 2021, the Hang Seng Index accelerated its decline, ending the year at 14,687 points on October 31, the lowest since 2009 (Chart 4). The sharp adjustment was initially triggered by market concerns over local COVID-19 outbreaks, U.S. interest rate hikes, and geopolitical tensions in Russia and Ukraine, followed by further deterioration of global economic prospects due to tightening of global financial conditions and the impact of COVID-19 outbreaks in Mainland China. In the last two months of the year, the market regained some upward momentum, partly supported by the Mainland China’s relaxation of pandemic control measures. The Hang Seng Index closed at 19,781 points at year-end, down 15.5% from the end of 2021, marking the third consecutive year of decline.

# Property Market

Under tightening financial conditions and weakened economic activities, the residential property market also came under pressure. Property prices fell by 15% in 2022 (Chart 4), and transaction volume plummeted by 39% to 45,050 cases, hitting record lows. Despite falling property prices, housing affordability remained tight. The actual mortgage rate increased from about 1.6% to between 3.375% and 3.625%, raising mortgage payments for homebuyers. The non-residential property market further softened, with high vacancy rates leading to price declines and rents remaining relatively soft.

Chart 4 Asset prices
Source: Rating and Valuation Department and Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited

# Economic Outlook

# Economic Environment

Benefiting from comprehensive border reopening between Mainland China and Hong Kong, Hong Kong’s economy is projected to recover from lows in 2023. Despite a likely slowdown in growth among advanced economies dragging down Hong Kong’s merchandise exports, the economic recovery in Mainland China and the elimination of border-crossing freight restrictions are expected to support the local economy. The border reopening is also expected to significantly benefit inbound tourism and other service exports, boost local business sentiment, and stimulate capital expenditure. Private consumption is also expected to further improve with the labour market recovery. The government forecasts that the real GDP in 2023 will grow markedly, between 3.5% and 5.5%. Nevertheless, the outlook for Hong Kong’s economic growth remains subject to numerous risks and uncertainties, largely depending on the policy interest rate trend of the Federal Reserve, global growth prospects, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and the pace of inbound tourism recovery.

# Inflation and Labour Market

Looking ahead, moderate inflation is expected to slightly rise, but overall inflation should stay mild due to offsetting factors. External prices may remain high due to persistent high energy and food prices, but with economic slowdowns in major economies and easing commodity price pressures, inflationary momentum may weaken further. Similarly, domestic cost pressures may increase slightly as economic recovery and labour market improvement continue, though soft housing rents should continue to partly offset these increases. The government forecasts the overall and core inflation rates for 2023 at 2.9% and 2.5%, respectively. Meanwhile, labour market conditions are expected to further improve as economic activities normalise.

# Performance of the Banking Sector

Hong Kong’s banking system faced a challenging macroeconomic environment in 2022, including the outbreak of the fifth wave of COVID-19 at the beginning of the year, rising geopolitical tensions, and significant interest rate hikes by major central banks to curb inflation. Despite these challenges, banks remained resilient, with strong capital and liquidity positions. The credit risk increased during the year, but overall asset quality remained healthy. Meanwhile, rising interest rates led to an increase in net interest income, although this was partly offset by higher loan loss provisions and declines in fee and commission income. Overall, retail banking profitability improved compared to 2021.

# Asset Quality

The specific classification loan ratio of the banking sector increased from 0.89% at the end of 2021 to 1.38% at the end of 2022. The ratio of overdue and restructured loans rose from 0.56% to 0.85% during the same period (Chart 5). The specific classification loan ratio for Mainland-related loans was 2.21% at the end of 2022, up from 0.89% at the end of 2021. The increase was mainly due to downgrades in the credit ratings of some Mainland property developers. Nevertheless, banks maintained sufficient provisions, with the aggregate loan loss reserve coverage (i.e., combined loan loss reserves and specific classification loan ratios) about 80% as of end-2022. Deducting the net realisable value of collateral from non-performing loan balances, the coverage ratio stands at approximately 140%. On the other hand, the delinquency ratios for residential mortgages and credit cards remained low at 0.06% and 0.23%, respectively (Chart 6).

Chart 5 Asset quality of the banking sector
Note: Figures cover Hong Kong offices, overseas branches, and major overseas subsidiaries.
Source: HKMA

Chart 6 Delinquency ratios of residential mortgages and credit cards
Source: HKMA

# Profitability Trends

The banking sector continued to record profits in 2022. The pre-tax operating profit of retail banking increased by 19.0% for the year (Chart 7). The improvement was driven by a 34% increase in net interest income and a 72% rise in income from FX and derivatives, partly offset by a 151% surge in impairment allowances and a 19% decrease in fee and commission income. Rising interest rates widened the net interest margin from 0.98% in the previous year to 1.31% in 2022 (Chart 8). Increased market volatility throughout the year also boosted income from FX and derivative activities. The increase in impairment allowances was mainly due to provisions for new specific classification loans, while weaker market performance resulted in lower fee and commission income. The cost-to-income ratio of retail banks decreased from 54.7% in 2021 to 48.0% in 2022 (Chart 9).

Chart 7 Retail banking performance
Source: HKMA

Chart 8 Net interest margin of retail banking
Source: HKMA

Chart 9 Cost-to-income ratio of retail banking
Source: HKMA

# Assets and Liabilities Trends

The assets and liabilities of the banking sector expanded by 2.5% in 2022. Asset growth was driven by increases in foreign exchange and derivative holdings at fair value. Facing external uncertainties and rising interest rates, loan demand weakened during the year. Compared with a 3.8% increase in 2021, total loans declined by 3.0% in 2022. Loans outside Hong Kong decreased by 10.2%, trade financing declined by 13.5%, while loans used within Hong Kong slightly increased by 0.9%. Mainland-related loans, after a 3.7% growth in 2021, decreased by 4.4% in 2022.

On the liability side, bank deposits continued to grow modestly. Total deposits increased by 1.7% in 2022, compared to a 4.6% rise in 2021. With decreases in total loans and increases in deposits, the overall loan-to-deposit ratio slightly fell from 71.8% at end-2021 to 68.5% at end-2022 (Chart 10).

# Capital Adequacy Levels

The capital position of banks in 2022 remained ample. The overall total capital ratio of locally incorporated authorised institutions was 20.1% at end-2022, slightly below 2021’s 20.2%; the Tier 1 capital ratio was 18.1% (Chart 11). Both remained well above the respective international minimum requirements. The Basel III leverage ratio stood at 7.9% at end-2022 (Chart 12).

Chart 10 Loans and deposits of the banking sector
Source: HKMA

Chart 11 Capital adequacy ratio of locally incorporated authorised institutions
Source: HKMA

Chart 12 Basel III leverage ratio of locally incorporated authorised institutions
Source: HKMA

# Liquidity Conditions

The liquidity of the banking system continued to be robust, serving as a key pillar amid escalating macroeconomic uncertainties. The quarterly average liquidity coverage ratio for Category 1 institutions was 162.3% in Q4 2022, and the average liquidity maintenance ratio for Category 2 institutions remained at 63.2% (Chart 13). The main funding source remains customer deposits. As of end-2022, the net stable funding ratio for Category 1 institutions was 137.7%, and the core funding ratio for Category 2A institutions stood at 155.7% (Chart 14). # 貨幣穩定

隨着美國收緊貨幣政策，港元在2022年轉弱，弱方兌換保證於5月至11月期間被觸發41次。在本港股市成交轉旺及年底季節性資金需求的帶動下，港元在11月中開始轉強。在聯繫匯率制度下，香港銀行同業拆息大致跟隨美元銀行同業拆息的走勢。由於美國持續加息，香港銀行同業拆息於2022年內逐步上升。整體而言，港元外匯及貨幣市場保持穩定，交易暢順有序。作為香港貨幣及金融穩定的基石，聯繫匯率制度一直展現強大抵禦外來衝擊的能力。

香港貨幣政策的主要目標是維持貨幣穩定，即確保港元匯價穩定，使港元在外匯市場兌美元的匯率保持在7.75至7.85港元兌1美元的區間內。該貨幣體制主要採用貨幣發行局制度，規定由外匯基金所持的美元儲備向貨幣基礎提供最少百分之百的支持；貨幣基礎若有變動，美元儲備亦必須作出相應增減，與貨幣基礎的變動百分之百配合。

# Currency Stability

As the United States tightened its monetary policy, the Hong Kong dollar weakened in 2022, with the exchange guarantee for the weakening side being triggered 41 times from May to November. Driven by increased turnover in the local stock market and seasonal capital demand at year-end, the Hong Kong dollar started to strengthen in mid-November. Under the linked exchange rate system, Hong Kong banks' interbank rates generally followed the trend of US dollar interbank rates. Due to ongoing US rate hikes, Hong Kong banks' interbank rates gradually rose in 2022. Overall, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange and monetary markets remained stable, with smooth and orderly trading. As the cornerstone of Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability, the linked exchange rate system has consistently demonstrated strong resilience against external shocks.

# Objectives

The primary goal of Hong Kong’s monetary policy is to maintain monetary stability, which means ensuring the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate, keeping its rate against the US dollar within the range of 7.75 to 7.85 HKD to 1 USD. This monetary regime primarily adopts the Currency Board System, which stipulates that the US dollar reserves held by the Exchange Fund must provide at least 100% support to the monetary base; if the monetary base changes, the US dollar reserves must adjust correspondingly, ensuring a 100% match with the change in the monetary base.

The monetary base (Table 1) includes:
- Liabilities certificates (fully backing banknotes issued by three note-issuing banks);
- Circulating banknotes and coins issued by the government;
- Total balance in the settlement accounts held at the Monetary Authority (i.e., the aggregate balance); and
- Exchange Fund notes and bonds issued by the Government on behalf of the government.

The Monetary Authority maintains the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate through an automatic interest rate adjustment mechanism and a firm commitment to fulfill the exchange guarantee. When the guarantee for the strong side (or weak side) is triggered, the Monetary Authority will, at the bank’s request, sell HK dollars and buy US dollars at the rate of 7.75 HKD per USD (or buy HK dollars and sell USD at 7.85 HKD per USD), causing the aggregate balance to increase (or decrease), thereby reducing (or increasing) the Hong Kong dollar interest rate and helping the exchange rate to return within the 7.75 to 7.85 HKD per USD range.

# 2022 Review

# Exchange Rate Stability

Driven by local stock market adjustments, market expectations of further US rate hikes, and arbitrage trading under the negative interest differential between the Hong Kong interbank rate and the London Interbank Offered Rate, the Hong Kong dollar weakened at the beginning of 2022 and remained close to the weak-side exchange guarantee level in subsequent months. The weak-side guarantee was triggered 41 times from May to November. Heightened turnover in the local stock market and seasonal capital demands at year-end led the Hong Kong dollar to strengthen in mid-November (Figure 1). Overall, the Hong Kong dollar FX market continued to function normally throughout 2022.

To cope with continuous demand from banks for Exchange Fund Notes, the Monetary Authority issued a total of HKD 40 billion in Exchange Fund Notes at the start of 2022. Additionally, from May to November 2022, according to the design of the linked exchange rate system, the Monetary Authority bought HKD 242.1 billion worth of HK dollars at the weak-side guarantee exchange rate level upon banks’ requests. The aggregate balance decreased from HKD 377.5 billion at the end of 2021 to HKD 96.3 billion at year-end 2022, reflecting the impact of the issuance of Exchange Fund Notes and the triggering of the weak-side guarantee. Meanwhile, the total amount of outstanding Exchange Fund Notes and bonds increased slightly from HKD 1,148.8 billion to HKD 1,200.4 billion during the year. Therefore, the aggregate balance combined with the total of outstanding Exchange Fund Notes and bonds decreased from HKD 1,526.3 billion at the end of 2021 to HKD 1,296.7 billion at the end of 2022 (Figure 2). Overall, the monetary base continued to be fully supported by foreign exchange reserves.

Figure 1: Market Exchange Rate in 2022

Figure 2: Total Balance (before Discount Window Activities) and Outstanding Exchange Fund Notes and Bonds in 2022

# Money Market

Under the linked exchange rate system, Hong Kong banks’ interbank rates generally followed the trend of US dollar interbank rates. Due to continued US rate hikes in 2022, Hong Kong banks' interbank rates gradually increased (Figure 3). Over the course of the year, the overnight, 1-month, and 3-month Hong Kong interbank rates rose by 318, 419, and 473 basis points respectively, reaching 3.23%, 4.35%, and 4.99% at year-end.

In response to the upward adjustment of the US federal funds target rate, the base rate was raised seven times, totaling 4.25 percentage points (or 425 basis points), from 0.5% to 4.75% (Figure 3). Retail banks also responded, with some increasing the best lending rate by 12.5 basis points in late September, another 25 basis points in early November, and a further 25 basis points in mid-December. Some banks also raised the cap on new mortgage rates based on Hong Kong interbank rates during the year. Overall, the Hong Kong monetary market continued to function normally. Discount window lending increased from HKD 6.8 billion in 2021 to HKD 8.4 billion in 2022.

Figure 3: Hong Kong Interbank Rates in 2022

# Linked Exchange Rate System

For nearly 40 years, the linked exchange rate system has been a vital pillar of Hong Kong’s financial system, demonstrating strong resilience in facing challenges. Despite fluctuations in global financial conditions in 2022, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange and monetary markets remained orderly, reflecting the robustness and effectiveness of the linked exchange rate system. The government remains resolutely committed to maintaining the linked exchange rate system. The International Monetary Fund, in its '2022 External Sector Report', reaffirmed that Hong Kong possesses transparent rules, substantial fiscal and foreign exchange reserves, sound financial regulation and supervision, economic flexibility, and a prudent fiscal framework, all of which ensure the credibility of the linked exchange rate system.

A robust banking system plays a crucial role in the normal operation of the linked exchange rate system. Hong Kong’s banking system continued to operate smoothly, with liquidity and capital levels being very ample by international standards. To ensure the banking system’s resilience against shocks, the Monetary Authority closely monitors banks' credit, liquidity, and interest rate risk management, along with stress testing results, and maintains rigorous supervision of bank lending.

Since October 1998, to enhance transparency of the currency issuance account, some assets of the Exchange Fund have been designated to support the monetary base. The support ratio (i.e., the ratio of supporting assets to the monetary base) fluctuated between 109.3% and 111.0% in 2022, without hitting either the upper or lower limit. As of December 31, the support ratio closed at 110.1% (Figure 4). Under the linked exchange rate system, although some Exchange Fund assets are designated as supporting portfolios, all assets of the Exchange Fund are available to support the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate. The substantial fiscal resources of the Exchange Fund, combined with the resilient banking system, provide strong backing for Hong Kong’s monetary and financial stability.

Figure 4: Daily Support Ratio in 2022

# Currency Issuance Committee

The Currency Issuance Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee is responsible for overseeing and exploring issues related to Hong Kong’s monetary and financial stability. In 2022, the Committee discussed topics including China’s mainland property market conditions, the role of non-bank institutions in the residential mortgage market, applications of deep learning in credit risk assessment, and a monitoring framework for assessing Hong Kong dollar liquidity. The minutes of the Committee meetings and the reports on the operation of the Currency Board System submitted by the Monetary Authority are available on the Monetary Authority’s website.

# Banknotes and Coins

# Hong Kong Banknotes

The Monetary Authority continued to hold seminars to educate bank counter staff, retail cashiers, and students on the design and anti-counterfeiting features of Hong Kong banknotes, enhancing their knowledge and skills in banknote identification. In 2022, the Authority organized 15 seminars, attracting over 4,200 participants.

# Coin Collection Program

The coin collection program remained popular among citizens. Details are provided in the chapter "Sustainable Development of the Monetary Authority" in the 2022 Sustainable Development Report.

# Exchange Fund Notes and Bonds

The Exchange Fund Notes and Bonds program continued to operate smoothly. To meet the ongoing demand from banks for Exchange Fund Notes and considering market conditions, the Monetary Authority issued a total of HKD 40 billion worth of Exchange Fund Notes during the first two months of 2022, which resulted in a corresponding decrease in the total balance. As of the end of 2022, the total nominal value of outstanding Exchange Fund Notes and bonds was approximately HKD 1,207.5 billion (Table 2).

Table 2: Outstanding Exchange Fund Notes and Bonds

# Monetary Research

The Hong Kong Institute for Monetary and Financial Research (the Research Centre) completed three policy research reports, published 24 research papers, and organized 16 seminars/webinars covering topics of strategic importance to Hong Kong and the region in monetary and financial research. The Research Centre also made further arrangements by launching a newly open-access electronic journal to disseminate research findings to a broader audience. Additionally, a new series of publications titled "Insights from Monetary Research Digest" was launched on the Centre’s website, providing the public with summaries of recent research outcomes in a non-technical, high-level format.

Beyond research findings, the Centre also hosted two international conferences and three online expert webinars to enhance dialogue and exchange on economic and financial matters:

- On April 12, jointly organized with the Hong Kong Institute of Financial Analysts, a webinar titled “Latest Developments in Macroeconomics, US Federal Reserve Tightening, and Offshore RMB Market Development,” featuring guest speakers Mr. Norman Chan, former Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, and Professor Huang Yiping, Vice Dean of the Institute of Digital Finance at Peking University. The webinar was live-streamed on multiple platforms, attracting a total online real-time audience of 840,000 views.

- On June 24, held a webinar titled “Transformation of China’s Real Estate Industry and Policy Choices,” featuring Ms. Qin Hong, Senior Research Fellow at Renmin University of China and former Director of the Policy Research Center of the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, as the keynote speaker. Dr. Wang Tao, Chief China Economist at UBS Asia and Head of China Economics Research, moderated the event. The webinar drew nearly 1.13 million live online viewers from the Mainland, Hong Kong, and other parts of the world.

- On August 25, jointly organized with the Asian Development Bank and the Bank for International Settlements a workshop on “Monetary Policy Spillover Effects,” with over 200 central bank officials, international financial organizations, and academic experts worldwide participating online.

- As an auxiliary event of the International Financial Leaders Investment Summit, on November 2, jointly organized with the Hong Kong Institute of Financial Analysts an online webinar titled “Post-COVID Inflation: Inevitable or Avoidable?” featuring Mr. Qi Linhuo, Founder and Chief Economist of International Money Observatory and former Chief Economist of Invesco. Nearly 200 economists participated online.

- On November 23, held the 12th Annual China Economic International Seminar on “A New Stage of Chinese Economic Development.” Dr. Wang Yiming, Vice Chairman of the China Centre for International Economic Exchanges and Chair of the Academic Committee, delivered a keynote speech on China’s short- and long-term economic outlook. Four chief economists from major Chinese investment banks shared their views on China’s pandemic policies, real estate market, supply chain reorganization, and long-term growth prospects in a panel discussion. The event attracted a real-time online audience of approximately 1.18 million viewers.

# 銀行體系穩定

儘管宏觀環境充滿不確定性及挑戰，加上金融市場異常波動，香港銀行體系於2022年維持穩健。年內金管局亦加強對認可機構信用及市場風險管理的監管。此外，鑑於網絡威脅持續增加及銀行業數碼轉型步伐加快，金管局與認可機構緊密合作，提升認可機構的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力。

操守監管方面，金管局加強有關「先買後付」產品的消費者保障，並就物業轉按交易提供多一種支付安排。金管局又與其他監管機構合作，就虛擬資產的可持續發展制定監管架構，精簡投資產品銷售程序，以及推出全新的信託業務監管制度。年內有關個人信貸資料的「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」啟用，並推出新的強制性背景查核計劃，以應對「滾動的壞蘋果」現象。此外，面對因疫情而實施的旅遊限制，金管局協助推出便利措施讓客戶重新啟動銀行戶口。

因應最新的香港洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險評估，金管局與銀行透過公私營夥伴合作（包括反訛騙及洗黑錢情報工作組），鞏固香港的打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集生態圈，以及加強應對騙案。此外，金管局亦與策略夥伴合作，以能更充分了解及有效管理日益複雜的地緣政治環境所帶來的風險及不穩定因素。金管局又透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」系列進一步推動業界運用數據及科技，並同時加快金管局在反洗錢工作中採用監管科技的步伐。在國際事務方面，金管局積極參與財務行動特別組織的工作。

在2022年，本地就有關資本充足標準及披露標準等國際監管標準的實施上取得良好進展。此外，金管局亦大力提升業界的軟實力，包括與銀行業合作建立可持續的人才儲備，以及提升現有從業員的技能。年內金管局一直與銀行業緊密合作，改進及精簡監管政策與程序。

金管局亦繼續致力推進在本地及國際層面的工作，以確保香港備有具公信力的處置機制。具體工作包括制定新處置標準；進行地區危機模擬演習，以及在所有具本地系統重要性銀行建立一層新的吸收虧損能力資源，標誌着金管局在提升處置可行性上立下里程碑。

# 目標

金管局的整體目標之一是促進銀行體系的安全及穩定。要達致這個目標，實有賴建立及維持具高度應對能力且能為香港經濟提供所需關鍵金融服務的金融體系。

銀行可能因營運方式，甚或在極端情況下因失序地倒閉而影響銀行體系的穩定。作為監管當局，金融管理專員在保障金融穩定方面擔當重要角色，確保銀行有能力抵禦衝擊及應對危機恢復常態，以最終有助防止出現倒閉。金融管理專員負責對銀行進行審慎監管，以及認可香港的持牌銀行、有限制牌照銀行及接受存款公司（統稱「認可機構」）。

香港的審慎監管制度並非為確保「零風險」而設。作為其中一個處置機制當局，金融管理專員力求確保一旦有認可機構不再可持續經營，能有秩序地處理其倒閉。為此，香港已設立金融機構處置機制，金融管理專員在該機制下為認可機構（以及其他類型機構）的處置機制當局。為落實香港的處置機制，有必要制定處置規則及政策標準、進行處置規劃以排除認可機構處置可行性的障礙，以及建立金管局處置瀕臨倒閉認可機構的運作能力。為有效執行上述工作，金管局採納與國際一致及協調的方法。

金融管理專員亦負責指定及監察某些金融市場基建。金管局監察金融市場基建的目的，是促進有關基建的整體安全及效率、控制系統性風險，以及提高透明度。提升金融市場基建的抗震能力，能保障香港的貨幣與金融體系，避免因金融市場基建運作中斷而可能影響其穩定。
